overview:
Salvador de la Barrera is a mexican entrepreneur, he started his international career in New York City doing international training programs for the YMCA, from then he moved to London with the same organization which eventually led him to Hong Kong where he lived for 8 years. During his tenure in Asia he served in human development, management, sales and marketing. In 2008 he founded Latin2asia, a web portal that helped connect companies in Asia with their counterpart in Latin America. During the financial crisis of 2010 Latin Asia collapsed and eventually led de la Barrera to found Flipter.

With Flipter Salvador won the Hong Kong creative Microfund, seed money awarded to high-potential start-up projects or business concepts in the digital creative area. In 2011 his application was named one of Asia’s Top 50 apps and was accepted to participate in the Hong Kong Ceyberport Incubation program.

On January 2012 Salvador continued his international entrepreneurship journey and moved to Santiago, Chile when he was accepted to participate in the prestigious international accelerator program Start-Up Chile, where he is currently successfully developing his platform Flipter.
